title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.6.14-15 | 29-10-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: In this session we will be discussing from the 14th verse of the 6th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and an introduction to the topic: Srimad Bhagavatam, 1st Canto, 6th Chapter, 14th verse.

segments.key_quote: A travelling mendicant can meet the needs of the body, namely thirst and hunger, by the gifts of nature without being a beggar at the doors of the householder.
segments.summary: The speaker explains Narada Muni's travels and how a mendicant should rely on nature's gifts rather than begging, emphasizing self-sufficiency and detachment.

segments.key_quote: So to awaken them to spiritual reality is the duty of a traveling transcendentalist Parivrajakacharya.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the role of a traveling transcendentalist in enlightening householders who are often engrossed in family affairs.

segments.key_quote: Any man who is not materially prosperous can take shelter of these great mountains and he will be provided with everything required.
segments.summary: The speaker describes the Himalayas as a place of abundance, providing both material and spiritual necessities for those seeking shelter.

segments.key_quote: There are springs even hot water springs so that one can take bath when it is very cold in the hot water of the hot water spring and there are so many herbs to cure diseases.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the resources available in the Himalayas, including fruits, flowers, caves, and hot springs, emphasizing its suitability for secluded meditation.

segments.key_quote: After that under the shadow of a banyan tree in an uninhabited forest I began to meditate upon the super souls situated within using my intelligence as I had learned from liberated souls
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the next verse and explains Narada Muni's meditation on the Supersoul in a secluded forest, emphasizing the use of intelligence learned from liberated souls.

segments.key_quote: One should know perfectly well from the authoritative sources of scriptures through the transparent medium of a bona fide spiritual master and by proper use of one's trained intelligence for meditating upon the super soul dwelling within every living being
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of learning meditation from authoritative scriptures and a bona fide spiritual master, rather than following personal whims.

segments.key_quote: This consciousness is firmly developed by a devotee who has rendered loving service unto the Lord by carrying out the orders of the spiritual master.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that devotional service to Krishna, guided by a spiritual master, is crucial for developing the consciousness needed for effective meditation.

segments.key_quote: If at all we are serious about self-realization then we execute the instructions of the spiritual master very rigidly and with complete attention try to fix the problem.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by stressing the importance of rigidly following the spiritual master's instructions with complete attention and without speculation to achieve self-realization.
